chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy W Hampton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Comply with any sex offender treatment programs imposed by PO agent. Crt orders release of PSI for treatment purposes and psychological report. Sex Offender Registry Required.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with victim or her family-subject to review by PO agent and treatment counselor while children are under 18 yrs of age and mother agrees.

Trial judge - Br 12

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Jason D. Sanders appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $25,000 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.    If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with O.R.P., Regina H or any of Regina H's children
- Defendant shall not be in the 1600 Blk of Blue Mounds St, Black Earth.
- Defendant shall not have unsupervised contact with any inididual under the age of 18.
